chargeHist.descr: Battery to Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Special Plea Report Dated 10/28/22

Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Mahdee Muhammad.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return.  Doctor Niess filed an extension letter.  Court grants extension and rescheduled the matter.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Extension Letter by Doctor Jenna Niess
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 09-29-2022 Supervision Report
Signed and filed: Signed AMENDED Order for Examination
Received and Filed: AMENDED Proposed Order for Examination
Pretrial Services Violation Report
signed, Order for NGI Examination

Defense requests NGI evaluation. NGI evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Niess on 09-09-2022 at 11:00 am. Case remains calendared in Branch 02.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in effect with H.S. and Economy Inn

Turnover to Justice Point for level 3 supervision.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Return on doctor report held. No challenges by parties. Court reinstates proceedings.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Mahdee Muhammad not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OFF THE RECORD. Case scheduled for return on doctor report. WFU did not receive an order. Case adjourned, branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case in court for return on doctor report. Defendant challenges report. Discussion held off the record. On State's motion and with no objection from defense, Court orders another examination and updated report based upon medication changes. Court grants motion. Case adjourned for return on doctor report, Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in Court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in custody.  William R. F. Ackell on behalf of James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return with Defendant's other Case, 22CF2115. Defendant and Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Forensic Unit has NOT filed a Doctor's Report Return. Additionally, parties advised the Court that case should be assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Report forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
 Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 5.17.22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mahdee Muhammad in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
